messages.message:
I'm on 25.32 and I'm having some trouble restarting server-nginx. It hangs at the last line:

```docker run  --name instabase-server-nginx  \
--env-file localsettings.env \
-p 80:8081 --rm -i instabase/server-nginx```
I've tried going to the webpage after and I get a 502 error showing it's unable to handle the request
I've found a workaround which is forwarding it to my localhost but do we know why it's stuck at this step?
hmm I didn't resync / restart the workspace (just did `cs restart`) so it is possible that's the issue

@Sayan you may need to edit your crafting sandbox to route the https endpoint to port 80 instead of 8080. The template and master branch use 8080 for nginx to avoid a port conflict with some of crafting’s internal infrastructure, but older branches still use port 80 for nginx. They need to match.
If you can’t figure out what to do, I can show you tomorrow!
Ah I think that's it actually. That explains why port forwarding to my laptop worked.
I won't need it right now since I solved the issue on that branch but will refer to this if needed
